official-title.#text:
Establishing a Select Committee on POW and
		  MIA Affairs.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(hereafter referred to
			 as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

text.#text:
There is established a select committee to
			 be known as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a full
			 investigation of all unresolved matters relating to any United States personnel
			 unaccounted for from the Vietnam era, the Korean conflict, World War II, Cold
			 War Missions, Persian Gulf War, Operation Iraqi Freedom, or Operation Enduring
			 Freedom, including MIAs and POWs missing and captured.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be composed of 10 Members of the House, who shall be
			 appointed by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . Not more than half of the members of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be of the same political party.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be filled in
			 the same manner in which the original appointment was made.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

text.#text:
Any
			 vacancy occurring in the membership of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall designate one member of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to be its
			 chairperson.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(or any
			 subcommittee of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
authorized to hold hearings) may sit and
			 act during the present
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
at any time or place within the United States
			 (including any Commonwealth or possession of the United States, or elsewhere,
			 whether the

is in session, has recessed, or has adjourned) and to hold
			 such hearings as it considers necessary.

text.#text:
For
			 purposes of carrying out this resolution, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

text.#text:
Clauses 1, 2, and 4 of rule XI of the Rules of the
			 House of Representatives shall apply to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not be
			 construed to limit the applicability of clause 2(i) of rule XI of the Rules of
			 the House of Representatives to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: 113 HRES 231/s:4/ss:a
Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

header.#text:
Prohibition
			 against meeting at certain times

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. Such payments shall be made on vouchers signed by the
			 chairman of the select committee and approved in the manner directed by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. Amounts made available under this paragraph
			 shall be expended in accordance with regulations prescribed by the

text.#text:
There shall be paid out of the applicable
			 accounts of the House such sums as may be necessary for the expenses of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

text.#text: In carrying out its functions under this resolution, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: considers necessary;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

text.#text:
appoint, either on
			 a permanent basis or as experts or consultants, any staff that the

prescribe the
			 duties and responsibilities of the staff;

fix the
			 compensation of the staff at a single per annum gross rate that does not exceed
			 the highest rate of basic pay, as in effect from time to time, of level V of
			 the Executive Schedule in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
considers appropriate;
			 and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

text.#text:
terminate the
			 employment of any such staff as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and of its staff for travel, subsistence, and other
			 necessary expenses incurred by them in the performance of their functions for
			 the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , other than expenses in connection with any meeting of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or a subcommittee thereof, held in the District of
			 Columbia.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and all authority granted in this resolution shall expire 30
			 days after the filing of the final report of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with the
			 House.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
shall submit to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a final report setting forth its
			 findings and recommendations as a result of its investigation.

text.#text: As soon as practicable during the present

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
when the House is
			 not in session shall be filed with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs
Clerk of the House

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be referred
			 to the committee or committees that have jurisdiction over the subject matter
			 of the report.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 the records, files, and materials of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be transferred
			 to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . If the final report of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Clerk of the House

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 referred to only one committee under the provisions of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the
			 records, files, and materials of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: 113 HRES 231/s:6/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be transferred
			 instead to the committee to which the final report is referred.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Select Committee on POW and MIA Affairs

term.#tail:
means any Representative in, or Delegate or
			 Resident Commissioner to, the Congress.

means any United States personnel that is unaccounted for and
			 missing in action.

means any United States personnel that is unaccounted for and
			 known to be a prisoner of war.
